title: CSS Variables & Typography System
description:
Establish Design System Foundation with CSS Custom Properties

Create a comprehensive set of CSS custom properties (CSS variables) that define the global design system foundation, including a cohesive color palette and typography system to ensure visual consistency across all application components.

Requirements:

Color System:
- Define primary color palette using navy/dark blue as the main brand color with appropriate shade variations (lighter/darker tones for hover states, disabled states, etc.)
- Set white as the default background color with potential variants for subtle backgrounds
- Establish accent color palette for secondary actions, highlights, and UI feedback (success, warning, error, info states)
- Include semantic color tokens (e.g., --color-primary, --color-background, --color-accent-success)
- Define text colors for different hierarchy levels (primary text, secondary text, disabled text)
- Ensure sufficient color contrast ratios for accessibility compliance (WCAG AA minimum)

Typography System:
- Configure Inter and DM Sans as the primary font families with appropriate fallback stacks
- Define font family tokens for different use cases (e.g., --font-heading, --font-body)
- Establish a modular type scale with font sizes for all text hierarchy levels (headings h1-h6, body text, small text, etc.)
- Set line height values optimized for readability at each font size
- Create a consistent spacing scale based on a base unit (e.g., 4px or 8px) for margins, padding, and gaps

Implementation Details:
- Organize variables in a dedicated CSS file (e.g., :root selector in globals.css or variables.css)
- Use clear, semantic naming conventions for all custom properties
- Document the purpose and usage of each variable category
- Consider creating a visual reference guide showing all defined tokens
- Ensure variables are accessible throughout the application's component hierarchy

Edge Cases to Consider:
- Browser compatibility for CSS custom properties (provide fallbacks if supporting older browsers)
- Dark mode preparation (structure variables to allow easy theme switching in future)
- Print stylesheets may need specific overrides
